output.conclusion: This course provides an advanced understanding of control systems, equipping students with the knowledge and skills to analyze, design, and implement sophisticated control strategies for complex systems.
output.introduction: Welcome to Advanced Control Systems! This course delves into the intricacies of control system design and analysis, building upon foundational knowledge to explore advanced topics such as nonlinear control, optimal control, and adaptive control. We will use mathematical modeling and simulation tools to understand and implement control systems.

chapters.description: Introduction to nonlinear systems, describing functions, phase plane analysis, limit cycles, and stability analysis using Lyapunov's methods. Examples of common nonlinearities in control systems.
Exact and input-output linearization techniques for nonlinear systems. Application of feedback linearization to control design. Case studies and examples.
Introduction to sliding mode control, design of sliding surfaces, chattering phenomenon, and methods for chattering reduction. Applications in robotics and aerospace.
Introduction to optimal control problems, performance indices, Pontryagin's minimum principle, and Hamilton-Jacobi-Bellman equation. Examples of optimal control problems.
LQR design for continuous-time and discrete-time systems. Selection of weighting matrices, stability analysis, and robustness considerations. Practical implementation of LQR.
Introduction to MPC, prediction models, cost functions, constraints, and optimization algorithms. Applications of MPC in process control and automotive systems.
Introduction to adaptive control, direct and indirect adaptive control schemes, parameter estimation techniques, and stability analysis of adaptive systems.
MRAC design for linear and nonlinear systems. MIT rule, Lyapunov redesign, and stability augmentation techniques. Applications of MRAC in aerospace and robotics.
Introduction to STR, recursive parameter estimation, pole placement design, and robustness considerations. Applications of STR in process control and automotive systems.
